poem:
Title: "In the Gallery of Perception"

Every inch of canvas touched by thought,
a stroke, a smear, a spatter caught.
Frankly judged as good or bad?
Perhaps, but shouldn't one be glad,
for each attempt to break the mould,
the timid, brash, naive or bold.
The art of seeing isn't taught,
in the beholder's eye lies naught.
Is this the value art ought to hold?
My answer echoes - Uncontrolled.
